intro: Bupleurum pauciradiatum var. kotschyanum, commonly known as the Kotschyan's bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow to greenish-yellow flowers during the summer months. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
